message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.NE 

This paper is primarily focused on using reinforcement learning (RL) techniques to enable robots to learn and adapt to changes in their environment and task. As such, it is likely to be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of GVFs (General Value Functions) and their incremental construction over time, which suggests a potential fit with the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of the SR (Successor Representation) to improve learning efficiency, which could potentially fall under the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of neural networks to implement the proposed approach, which suggests a potential fit with the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
